data.title: About Us — Dovetail Impact Foundation
data.text:
Dovetail Impact Foundation (formerly David Weekley Family Foundation) was established in 1990 with profits from David Weekley Homes, a U.S. homebuilding company started by David Weekley in 1976.

We initially philanthropically engaged in our local community of Houston, Texas, USA. But since then, our work has expanded across the globe as our partners confront challenges that require the very best of our hearts, minds, and spirits.

We now celebrate 30 years of partnership with 115 organizations working in 35 countries.

Amit Antony Alex serves as an Investment Director with Dovetail Impact Foundation where he supports an international portfolio of partner organizations and is based out of Bengaluru, India. Prior to joining Dovetail Impact, Amit worked as the Country Director for Upaya Social Ventures where he led investments and portfolio management in early stage enterprises, creating livelihood opportunities for people in extreme poverty. Prior to Upaya, he was the Enterprise Development Manager at the United Nations Foundation’s Clean Cooking Alliance, heading grants and capacity building support to enterprises globally.

Sam supports a diverse set of innovative organizations in and beyond West Africa within the International Portfolio. Prior to joining Dovetail, he spent six years as an independent consultant, working with innovative secular and faith-based social enterprises and not-for-profits in West Africa and the Caribbean. He brought a focus on operational systems strengthening and best-practice sharing to companies working in health care, livelihoods, emergency response, and renewable energy.

During the West African Ebola outbreak, Sam worked with Last Mile Health in Liberia, helping set up its first field office outside its pilot site and co-implementing its first USAID grant. He joined LMH from Dimagi, an information and communication technology for development company that was then expanding and formalizing its West African operations. Sam helped launch a pair of national-scale programs in the Sahel before backstopping the setup of Dimagi’s regional hub in Dakar.

Eliguard joins Dovetail Impact Foundation from Crossroads International, where he managed a diverse portfolio of partners in East and Southern Africa. In this capacity, he supported a diversity of partners delivering impact in livelihoods, health, access to justice, and leadership and participation. Prior to his work with Crossroads International, Eliguard served as the Mainland Tanzania Director at D-tree International, a Country Director at Digital Opportunity Trust, an Advisor at KPMG International Development Advisory, and an Associate Director at Peace Corps.

He also supported philanthropic foundations in building partnerships and partner capacity development. Eliguard's passion lies in leadership and organizational development. He possesses a Bachelor of Science Degree in Wildlife Management from Sokoine University and a Master of Science Degree in Education for Sustainability from London South Bank University. In addition to his professional pursuits, Eliguard is an avid reader, a dedicated marathon runner, and actively engages in small-holder farming.

Anna holds a Master’s in Global Policy and a Master’s in Public Health from the University of Texas, and a B.A. from Wheaton College (IL). Raised in Colorado, she now lives in Austin with her husband, son, and two dogs. Anna is passionate about wellbeing for all, teaching children through play, effective M&E , and long bike rides. Come to Anna for conversations about the Beatles, history, and how to see all the sides of an issue.

Over his 16 year tenure, Philip led IJM’s frontlines operations in 19 countries on 5 continents on a wide array of social justice and human rights challenges, including gender-based violence, human trafficking, police brutality, and online sexual exploitation of children. Philip was a partner in a full service law firm prior to joining IJM. Come to Philip for conversations about bass fishing, his Great Dane and his love of team.

Hillary serves as an Investment Director with Dovetail Impact Foundation where he supports an international portfolio of partner organizations and is based in Nairobi, Kenya. Prior to joining Dovetail Impact, Hillary served as the Executive Director for CFK Africa where he led the development of an ambitious investment framework that accelerated the scale-up of health, education and livelihoods services in informal and peri-urban settlements across Kenya.

Prior to CFK Africa, he was the Policy and Partnerships Director at Lwala Community Alliance, the Executive Director for Kakenya’s Dream, and a Clinic Services Manager for the CDC in Kenya. He holds a bachelor’s degree Social Sciences from the University of Nairobi and is an MSc. Health Economics Candidate at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine (LSHTM). Come to Hillary for conversations about DIY and restoration projects.

Jason holds a Master of Social Work from Baylor University, a Master of Divinity from George W. Truett Seminary at Baylor University, and a Ph.D. in Social Welfare from Florida International University. Jason and his wife, Angel, have spent much of the last 25 years working alongside one another in nonprofit work and have three grown sons and one grandson. Come to Jason to find your next great recipe or discuss the best fishing spots.

Robin Bruce serves as President of the Dovetail Impact Foundation where she’s honored to partner with exemplary entrepreneurs confronting the greatest challenges of our day. Prior to joining Dovetail in 2017, Robin spent four years as the CEO of the Acton School of Business, an award-winning entrepreneurial MBA in Austin, Texas. In her role, Robin had the privilege of walking alongside extraordinary individuals in their journey to become principled entrepreneurs.
